explanation: metal_linux_get_device_property directly calls to_linux_device. To determine whether the target function violates the MISRA rule (no direct or indirect recursion) you must examine the implementation of to_linux_device and any functions it (transitively) calls to see if there is a path back to metal_linux_get_device_property. If to_linux_device calls (directly or indirectly) metal_linux_get_device_property or any function that eventually calls it, an indirect recursion cycle would exist. No other callees of the target (standard library calls like open/read/close/snprintf) can create such a cycle in typical code, so only to_linux_device (and its transitive callees, discovered when inspecting its implementation) is required for this analysis.
